00100 #define SETUP_VALUE() MAKEWORD(SETUPDAT[3],SETUPDAT[2])
00101 #define SETUP_INDEX() MAKEWORD(SETUPDAT[5],SETUPDAT[4])

00123 typedef enum {
00124     GET_STATUS,
00125     CLEAR_FEATURE,
00126     // 0x02 is reserved
00127     SET_FEATURE=0x03,
00128     // 0x04 is reserved
00129     SET_ADDRESS=0x05, // this is handled by EZ-USB core unless RENUM=0
00130     GET_DESCRIPTOR,
00131     SET_DESCRIPTOR,
00132     GET_CONFIGURATION,
00133     SET_CONFIGURATION,
00134     GET_INTERFACE,
00135     SET_INTERFACE,
00136     SYNC_FRAME
00137 } SETUP_DATA;

00146 /*
00147  You can call this function directly if you are polling
00148  for setup data in your main loop.
00149  You can also use the usbjt and enable the sudav isr
00150  and call the function from withing the sudav isr routine
00151 */

00172 /* descriptor types */
00173 #define DSCR_DEVICE_TYPE 1
00174 #define DSCR_CONFIG_TYPE 2
00175 #define DSCR_STRING_TYPE 3
00176 #define DSCR_DEVQUAL_TYPE 6
00177 #define DSCR_OTHERSPD_TYPE 7
00178 
00179 /* usb spec 2 */
00180 #define DSCR_BCD 2
00181 
00182 
00183 /* device descriptor */
00184 #define DSCR_DEVICE_LEN 18
00185 
00186 typedef struct {
00187     BYTE dsc_len; // descriptor length (18 for this )
00188     BYTE dsc_type; // dscr type
00189     WORD bcd; // bcd
00190     BYTE dev_class; // device class
00191     BYTE dev_subclass; // sub class
00192     BYTE dev_protocol; // sub sub class
00193     BYTE max_pkt; // max packet size
00194     WORD vendor_id;
00195     WORD product_id;
00196     WORD dev_version; // product version id
00197     BYTE idx_manstr; //  manufacturer string index
00198     BYTE idx_devstr; // product string index
00199     BYTE idx_serstr; // serial number index
00200     BYTE num_configs; // number of configurations
00201         
00202 } DEVICE_DSCR;
00203 
00204 
00205 /* config descriptor */
00206 #define DSCR_CONFIG_LEN 9
00207 typedef struct {
00208     BYTE dsc_len; // 9 for this one
00209     BYTE dsc_type; // dscr type
00210     
00211 } CONFIG_DSCR;
00212 
00213 /* string descriptor */
00214 typedef struct {
00215     BYTE dsc_len;
00216     BYTE dsc_type;
00217     BYTE pstr;
00218 } STRING_DSCR;
